text.title:
CATALOGUE
O F
A Moft Curious and Valuable CABINET
O F
ROMAN and Other MEDALS and COINS,
In Gold, Silver, and Brass; The Property of a Gentleman lately arrived from
ITALY:
Among many equally rare, are,
THE TWELVE CiESARS,
In Gold, in the higheft Prefervation;
A great Variety of
Antique Marbles, neatly executed for forming Cabinets, Szc.
ALSO,
Some exceeding fin£ Antique Intaglios and Cameos fet in
Rings, &c. Bronzes, Models in Terra Cotta, matchklV
Pieces of Antique Rock Chrystal, an Epergne, fe- veral Lots of ufeful Plate, Jewels, he. Two magnifi
cent Cabinets for Medals and Jewels, and Two ele
gant Book-Cases, all richly inlaid.
Which will be Sold by A U C T I O N, '
By W. BRISTOW,
At the New Auction Room in Pall Mall, on Monday, Tuefday, and Wednefday, the 2d, 3d, and 4th of
March, beginning precifely at Twelve o'Clock.
The Whole may be viewed on Friday the 27th, and to the Time of Sale (Sunday excepted) when Catalogues may be
had at the Room ; and of W. Bristow, Rolls Buildings
Fetter-Lane : Who fells by Commiflion, on the moft rca-
Ionable Terms, Eftates, Stocks in Trade, Furniture, Me dals, Books, Pi&ures, Prints, &c. or procures immediate Purchafers for them.
text.preface:
Conditions of SALE.
I. »r p HE higheft Bidder is the Buyer; and if any
I Difpute arifes, the Lot to be put up again.
II. That no Perfon advance lefs than Six-pence ; above
a Pound, One Shilling; above Five Pounds, Two
Shillings and Six-pence.
III. The Buyer to give in his Name, Place of Abode,
and pay Five Shillings in the Pound earneft (if de
manded).
IV. The Lots to be taken away with all Faults, at the Buyer's Expence; and the Remainder of the Pur-
chafe Money to be paid on the Delivery, otherwife the Money depofited is to be forfeited, and the Lors uncleared to be fold by Public or Private Sale, and
the Deficiencies (if any) to be made good by the
Firft Purchafers.
V. The Lots will be delivered the Days of Sale, from
Nine in the Morning till Seven in the Evening (the Time of Sale only excepted); and it is moft earneftly
requefted the Buyers will be expeditious in taking away their Lots, as the Room mull be immediately
cleared.
!Thofe Gentlemen who cannot attend the Sale, may have
their Ccmmiffionsfaithfully executed, by their moft
Rolls Buildings,
.
Fetter lane.
Obedient and devoted
Humble Servant,
W. BRISTOW.
